text: It kind of makes me nostalgic

in this building because it's a
look that I

remember very well from the
from the 80s. A lot of people

hated it but it really does,
it gives it a liveliness

that the urban environment
might not have had.

After graffiti was no
longer on trains,

I think it migrated to
walls and to spaces like

this, which were abandoned
spaces, and kids

could come in here and
paint at their leisure.

It would be great to, if
this place is renovated it

would be great if this
interior walls were kept as

they were rather than
made pristine again

Of course graffiti is an
ephemeral art form so it was
